page.title: 06Farming in the Burford Area
page.content: Farms in the area are mixed and about 800 acres in size. They are worked by family members and or two farm workers. The family live in a farmhouse and the workers in tied cottages.The busiest times of the year are June for haymaking, July and August for the harvest and seed drilling in September and October.A dairy herd of 50 Friesian cattle and a flock of 250 sheep are usual.Sheep include Hampshire and Suffolk Cross breeds and around 100 lambs are born in February.Cattle eat kale and rye;sheep eat swedes and kale. Corn is sold to a grain merchant.Each farm is highly mechanized with tractors,a combine harvester,drill, cultivator,muck spreader, elevator and a fork lift.
